{{This date in recent years}}
{{Day}} This is the last possible day for the [[Summer solstice]] to occur in the Northern Hempisphere, and for the [[Winter solstice]] to occur in the Southern Hemisphere.

==Events==
*[[217 BC]] &ndash; [[Battle of Raphia]]: [[Ptolemy IV Philopator]] of Egypt defeats [[Antiochus III the Great]] of the [[Seleucid kingdom]].
*[[168 BC]] &ndash; [[Battle of Pydna]]: [[Roman Republic|Romans]] under [[Lucius Aemilius Paulus Macedonicus|Lucius Aemilius Paullus]] defeat [[Macedon]]ian King [[Perseus of Macedonia|Perseus]] who surrenders after the battle, ending the [[Third Macedonian War]].
*[[1527]] &ndash; [[Fatahillah]] chased away [[Portugal]] from Sunda Kelapa harbour, and peoples celebrated it as birthday of [[Jakarta]], [[Indonesia]].
*[[1593]] &ndash; [[Battle of Sisak]]: Allied [[Christian]] troops defeat the [[Ottoman Empire|Turks]].
*[[1622]] &ndash; [[Portuguese Empire|Portuguese]] forces repel a [[Dutch Republic|Dutch]] invasion at the [[Battle of Macau]] during the [[Dutch–Portuguese War]].
*[[1633]] &ndash; The [[Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith|Holy Office]] in [[Rome]] forces [[Galileo Galilei]] to recant his view that the [[Sun]], not the [[Earth]], is the center of the [[Universe]] in the form he presented it in, after heated controversy.
*[[1774]] &ndash; The British pass the [[Quebec Act]], setting out rules of governance for the colony of [[Quebec]] in British [[North America]].
*[[1783]] &ndash; A poisonous cloud caused by the [[Types of volcanic eruption|eruption]] of the [[Laki]] volcano in [[Iceland]] reaches [[Le Havre]] in [[France]].
*[[1807]] &ndash; In the [[Chesapeake–Leopard Affair]], the British warship {{HMS|Leopard|1790|6}} attacks and boards the American frigate {{USS|Chesapeake|1799|6}}.
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: After learning of American plans for a surprise attack on Beaver Dams in [[Ontario]], [[Laura Secord]] sets out on a 30 kilometer journey on foot to warn Lieutenant [[James FitzGibbon]].
*[[1825]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|British Parliament]] abolishes [[feudalism]] and the [[Seigneurial system of New France|seigneurial system]] in [[British North America]].
*[[1839]] &ndash; [[Cherokee]] leaders [[Major Ridge]], [[John Ridge]], and [[Elias Boudinot (Cherokee)|Elias Boudinot]] are assassinated for signing the [[Treaty of New Echota]], which had resulted in the [[Cherokee removal|Trail of Tears]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; US Congress created the [[United States Department of Justice]]
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[Royal Navy]] [[battleship]]  {{HMS|Camperdown|1885|6}} accidentally rams the [[British Mediterranean Fleet]] [[flagship]] {{HMS|Victoria|1887|6}} which sinks taking 358 crew with her, including the fleet's commander, Vice-Admiral Sir [[George Tryon]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; [[British Colony|British colonial officers]] Charles Walter Rand and Lt. Charles Egerton Ayerst are assassinated in [[Pune]], [[Maharashtra]], [[India]] by the [[Chapekar brothers]] and Mahadeo Vinayak Ranade, who are later caught and hanged.
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Spanish–American War]]: [[United States Marines]] land in [[Cuba]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; The [[flag of Sweden]] is adopted.
*[[1907]] &ndash; The [[London Underground]]'s [[Charing Cross, Euston and Hampstead Railway]] opens.
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[George V of the United Kingdom|George V]] and [[Mary of Teck]] are crowned [[List of British monarchs|King]] and [[List of British consorts|Queen]] of the [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[Hammond Circus Train Wreck]] kills 86 and injures 127 near [[Hammond, Indiana]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Herrin massacre]]: 19 strikebreakers and 2 union miners are killed in [[Herrin, Illinois]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; France is forced to sign the [[Armistice with France (Second Compiègne)|Second Compiègne]] [[armistice]] with [[Nazi Germany|Germany]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; Germany invades the [[Soviet Union]] in [[Operation Barbarossa]].
*  1941   &ndash; The [[June Uprising in Lithuania]] begins.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[Erwin Rommel]] is promoted to [[Field Marshal (Germany)|Field Marshal]] after the capture of [[Tobruk]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; Opening day of the Soviet Union's [[Operation Bagration]] against the [[Army Group Centre]].
*  1944   &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] signs into law the Servicemen's Readjustment Act of 1944, commonly known as the [[G.I. Bill]].
* [[1945]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Okinawa]] comes to an end. 
*[[1954]] &ndash;  In [[Christchurch]] ([[New Zealand]]) [[Pauline Parker]] and [[Juliet Hulme]] murder Pauline's mother because they think she is in the way of their close friendship (movie ''[[Heavenly Creatures]]'' by [[Peter Jackson]] in 1994). See [[Parker–Hulme murder case]]. 
*[[1957]] &ndash; The Soviet Union launches an [[R-12 Dvina|R-12 missile]] for the first time (in the [[Kapustin Yar]]).
*[[1969]] &ndash; The [[Cuyahoga River]] catches fire in [[Cleveland, Ohio]], drawing national attention to water pollution, and spurring the passing of the [[Clean Water Act]] and the creation of the [[Environmental Protection Agency]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Charon (moon)|Charon]], a satellite of the dwarf planet [[Pluto]], is discovered by American astronomer [[James W. Christy]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Virgin Atlantic Airways]] launches with its first flight from [[London Heathrow Airport]].
*[[1986]] The controversial [[Hand of God goal]] by [[Diego Maradona]] in the quarter-finals of the [[1986 FIFA World Cup]] match between [[Argentina]] and [[England]].  This was later followed by the [[Goal of the Century]] also by Maradona.  Argentina would win 2-1 and go on to win the world cup.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Checkpoint Charlie]] is dismantled in [[Berlin]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; An earthquake measuring 6.5 [[Richter magnitude scale|M<sub>w</sub>]] [[2002 Bou'in-Zahra earthquake|strikes]] a region of northwestern [[Iran]] killing at least 261 people and injuring 1,300 others and eventually causing widespread public anger due to the slow official response.
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Eastman Kodak Company]] announces that it will discontinue sales of the [[Kodachrome]] Color Film, concluding its 74-year run as a photography icon.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Paraguayan]] President [[Fernando Lugo]] is [[Impeachment of Fernando Lugo|removed from office]] by [[impeachment]] and succeeded by [[Federico Franco]].
